result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kahinda Tamone Robinson

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Kahinda Tamone Robinson in court.  Attorney Joel H. Rosenthal in court for Kahinda Tamone Robinson.  Prosecuting attorney Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for status conference. Parties ready to proceed with Deferred Prosecution Agreement hearing.
Parties are prepared to enter into a deferred prosecution agreement.
AS TO COUNT 1:
Defendant was advised of constitution rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Complaint/Information.  Court WITHHELD entry of judgment of conviction.  Deferred Prosecution Agreement received, signed and filed.
 
Court ordered case adjourned for Review in Branch 17.
Review hearing scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Kahinda Tamone Robinson in court.  Attorney Joel H. Rosenthal in court for Kahinda Tamone Robinson.  Prosecuting attorney Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Deferred Prosecution Agreement hearing.
Defense counsel informed the Court that defendant declines the DPA.
Court hold colloquy with parties and defendant. Defense counsel requests additional time to discuss with defendant.
Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 13.
Status conference scheduled for September 16, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Attorney Joel Rosenthal appeared in Court in person and informed the Court of unavailability for final pretrial scheduled 09/12/2022 and requested a reschedule to 09/14/2022 at 9:00 a.m. Court grants reschedule. Parties notifed.

Defendant Kahinda Tamone Robinson in court with attorney Joel H. Rosenthal.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Kahinda Tamone Robinson appeared by video means with Attorney. Defense requests a DPA date to allow time for defendant to be TAD evaluated.   Court ordered case adjourned for deferred prosecution hearing in Branch 37.   All parties are advised effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to a Branch of RESERVE JUDGES.  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Kahinda Tamone Robinson in court with attorney Joel H. Rosenthal.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
HEARING HELD VIA ZOOM/ LIVE STREAMING THROUGH DACAST. Case in court for pre-trial conference. 
Defense counsel advises the Court he was recently retained and asks for an adjournment to allow for time to meet with client. 
State advises the Court they are considering this case for possible DPA and advise Defense to scheuled TAD evaluation. 
court orders matter adjourned for status.  Status conference scheduled for June 10, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Court ordered no contact with D.L.N.R.
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Kahinda Tamone Robinson in court with attorney Haley E Wentz.  Defendant Kahinda Tamone Robinson in custody.  Dax Odom appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Kahinda Tamone Robinson appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/3c595ccd-39e3-09d4-8db1-82162d766d4f  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
